title: @Riot do you actively discourage morde from building spellvamp
body: I noticed morde's Q still procs spellvamp at 1/3 rate when it is indeed a single target spell. Did you forget to change that since his  pre-rework Q was aoe or did you guys do this to discourage people from building spellvamp on morde?

AP have 2 items (1 of which is a hybrid item, the other being the only pure AP items): {{item:3152}} {{item:3146}} 

But now let's look at something... Both AP items basically JUST provide spellvamp (gunblade has AD which is useless for most casters, active which isn't bad... WotA has 10% CDR and AP of course)

Then we have the AD choices...

{{item:3139}} provides both lifesteal, damage, AND a cleanse.

{{item:3156}} provides flat ArPen, MR, AD, + a shield for magic damage and lifesteal at low health.

{{item:3072}} allows you to overheal, giving you an additional shield to soak damage before dying.

{{item:3153}} gives you %HP physical damage, aspd, lifesteal, damage, and the active!

{{item:3812}} makes you take less damage, has AD, regen ALL physical damage, and has 10% CDR

(you could also note that Gunblade is really for both classes, but I definitely think you need AP due to the higher AP and lower AD stats on Gunblade).

What's the major difference? Every single one of the ADC items with lifesteal on them has some form of survivability or defensive use outside of JUST having lifesteal. BotRK is the only one that's less obviously defensive, but stealing someone's MS can make it much easier to kite them.

Meanwhile, mages have literally no defensive item that also give spellvamp. None. Nada. Zilch.

And while your idea of "ADCs are closer to the fight than mages" is kind of true, it's also kind of not. Sure it used to be the truth when mages like Karthus and Veigar were popular - Karthus being someone who wants to be at max range at all times and Veigar standing back until he can land a combo. But now that the game has evolved, mages NEED to be able to option select into spellvamp, and it really NEEDS to be a viable way to get health back. Playing midlane against stuff like Jayce with TP is literally torture for any mage, because if you beat him he can just buy a vamp scepter... Sustain in lane until he can't anymore and TP back, there's basically no appropriate response from the mid laner unless you manage to kill him. You can't possibly keep up with the sustain, unless you also took TP you can't back as freely, and you have 0 itemization options that will fix the problem unless, again, you get strong enough to just oneshot him. It removes a lot of the impetus from players in advantageous matchups to even play, as an AD vs AP with the advantage for the AD is much, much harder to play against than the reverse.

Mages have lots of survivability items.
{{item:3001}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3116}} {{item:3040}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3174}} all have defensive stats or abilities on them, and that's not even counting rarely built stuff like {{item:3060}}.

What they don't have is spellvamp specifically, because Riot has found it to be a problematic way to help mages survive (basically it's way too good on people like Vlad, and not that useful at all on people who will just run out of mana anyway).  It's possible that one reason Akali is so badly nerfed is that she works too well with {{item:3146}} and Riot is afraid of her getting out of control.

Until recently ADCs had few choices for survivability *other* than lifesteal, which is very little help when being 100-0'd by an unpeeled burst mage or assassin (their intended counter classes) and no help at all when hard CC'd.  Having them get a bit too much benefit out of {{item:3053}}  {{item:3156}} in otherwise offense-focused builds is what makes lifesteal too good; if you can't burst them down *and* you can't beat them in a long fight where they can lifesteal, then you can't beat them at all (or only with ignite available, which is rare in a double TP meta).

That's why I think those two items should be rebalanced to work better as the offensive part of a mostly defensive item build on someone like {{champion:36}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:54}} (juggernauts or tanky initiators) than as the one defensive item in an otherwise glass cannon build.  And judging from recent and PBE balance changes, Riot agrees.

Let's look at something though.

You've got {{item:3040}} ... The closest equivalent is the ADC {{item:3072}} as far as the shield... And the BT shield has NO COOLDOWN and refills with lifesteal while Seraph's Embrace has to be stacked to 750 mana before you can even activate the shield (and it has a 120 second cd on the shield itself... and the shield is based on how much mana you have when you use it.) BT is more expensive though, at 3700 total gold to Archangel's 3100 gold, but BT (imo) is a much better defensive item (though Seraph's is a better offensive item, due to the scaling potential).

This is just an example of the way that ADCs survivability items really just offer them a lot more than mage items. Mages definitely have a lot of access to flat MR/HP/Armor, but the ease with which they can access sustain or defensive items is lowered considerably. I think one of the biggest problems is {{item:3157}} to be completely honest with you - it's a very situationally strong item as a defensive item and I think it's basically cockblocking any other serious defensive mage items. But I'd really, really like to have access to an AP version of Mercurial Scimitar for games where a cleanse would be better than rooting myself for 2.5 seconds... And I think AD should have a version of Zhonya's. I don't think there should be this dichotomy where everyone has uneven access to defensive options, because it creates this world where we get items (like sterak's) that have AD on them and suddenly AD's have crazy access to defensive items, but I don't think Riot would ever introduced an AP themed survivability item like that because {{item:3157}} exists...

One big problem for Spell Vamp is that it's a very useful stat for sustained mages (like Vlad) and melee mages (Kata, Akali, Fizz...)
It is also good in 1v1's for any mage to recover from a trade, bad fight or not get backed at the wrong time. But once teamfights start, as a burst mage, you are trying to avoid damage and deal as much as you can in return - making it a completely wasted stat after late mid-late game. Once damage get so high that you risk getting 1-2 shotted, the stat is worthless.

I propose a change like this:

* Spell Vamp is still just in WotA, still _**Unique**_, same effect
* _** New Unique effect**_ - _**Vampiric Infusion (Aura):**_ Heal your teammates for 3% of the raw damage dealt by your abilities. Start with 5 stacks, gain + 1 stack/10 sec, spend 1 stack per ability used.

This way, you'd actually have supportive capabilities as a high damage burst mage and in my opinion, having it limited to stacks and static 3% damage (not split for AoE abilities) will also limit how much you can team heal at a time. You won't be penalized for not doing big AoE damage (you can fully use the effect on a single champion to heal you team up by a 5 spell roration) but it's not a better heal if you suddenly dump your abilities into a team - thus making AoE mages better than solo damage for team healing and damage mitigation from the champion select.

I realize that Spell Vamp from WotA used to be an Aura but it was simply the same bonus granted to all champions which wasn't a good idea. An Aura is good idea but Aura's effectiveness is solely based on your contribution to a fight so your allies can't abuse it this way by having high damage or frequent spells.

Just my 2 cents.
